response.summary:
Mechanical Engineer with experience in the development of basic and detailed engineering in industrial plants and surface facilities in the pharma, petrochemical sector- Oil & Gas. 

Capacity to work in interdisciplinary groups linked to rotating equipment (pumps, blowers, etc.), package units (water plants, compressed air, filtration, etc.) and thermal area (HVAC Systems) to developing activities in projects such as material requisitions, technical specifications, data sheets, HVAC calculation notes (HAP Software), technical bid tabulation, alignment of suppliers and vendor drawings review.
response.skills: Diseño, CAESAR II, PV ELITE, Tank, TANK, AutoCAD, Engineering, HVAC, Gestión de proyectos, Planificación estratégica, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft PowerPoint, Autodesk Inventor, Liderazgo, Oratoria, Cálculos de carga térmica, Pump selection, CREO PARAMETRIC 2.0

profile_positions.description: Specialist in rotating equipment, package units and HVAC systems, performing the following functions:- Issue of material requisitions with their annexed specifications for budget requests, inquiry and purchase. - Perform evaluation of technical bids tabulation type to achieve alignment of the supplier and objective technical recommendation. Vendor drawings review and technical support to other departments. Technical Field trip and reporting for client technical requirements.  - Perform thermal load calculations with specialized HVAC software (HAP), Air balance, ducts and pressurization estimating, data sheets, layouts, technical specifications.
profile_positions.title: Machinery and Package Units Specialist

profile_positions.description: Chemical substances documentation, EPPs, inventories and equipment remissions responsible. Factory inspections supervision, mechanism or parts design for remanufacturing process and participation in various bearing remanufacturing processes stages.
profile_positions.title: Workshop Trainee

company.name: Technip Energies
company.description:
Technip Energies is a leading Engineering & Technology company for the energy transition, with leadership positions in Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG), hydrogen and ethylene as well as growing market positions in blue and green hydrogen, sustainable chemistry and CO2 management. The company benefits from its robust project delivery model supported by extensive technology, products and services offering. 
Operating in 34 countries, our 15,000 people are fully committed to bringing our client’s innovative projects to life, breaking boundaries to accelerate the energy transition for a better tomorrow.
Technip Energies is listed on Euronext Paris with American depositary receipts (“ADRs”). For further information: www.technipenergies.com.
